00207 //**************************************************************************
00208 //
00209 // FileExists
00210 //
00211 //          Checks if a file exists.
00212 //
00213 // Parameter List :
00214 //
00215 //          STR   -> name of file to check existence of
00216 //
00217 // Return Value :
00218 //
00219 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if it exists
00220 //                            -> FALSE if not
00221 //
00222 // Modification history :
00223 //
00224 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00225 //
00226 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00227 //
00228 //    Oct 2005: Snap - Rewrote, made to check data catalogues
00229 //
00230 //**************************************************************************
00231 BOOLEAN     FileExists( STR strFilename )
00232 {
00233       // First check to see if it's in a library (most files should be there)
00234       if ( gFileDataBase.fInitialized &&
00235                CheckIfFileExistInLibrary( (STR) strFilename ) ) return TRUE;
00236 
00237       // ... then check if it's in the custom Data directory
00238       if ( gCustomDataCat.FindFile(strFilename) ) return TRUE;
00239 
00240       // ... then check if it's in the default Data directory
00241       if ( gDefaultDataCat.FindFile(strFilename) ) return TRUE;
00242 
00243       // ... lastly, try to locate it in the file system
00244       DWORD attribs = GetFileAttributes(strFilename);
00245       if ( attribs != INVALID_FILE_ATTRIBUTES && !(attribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) )
00246             return TRUE;
00247       
00248       return FALSE;
00249 }
00250 
00251 //**************************************************************************
00252 //
00253 // FileExistsNoDB
00254 //
00255 //          Checks if a file exists, but doesn't check the database files.
00256 //
00257 // Parameter List :
00258 //
00259 //          STR   -> name of file to check existence of
00260 //
00261 // Return Value :
00262 //
00263 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if it exists
00264 //                            -> FALSE if not
00265 //
00266 // Modification history :
00267 //
00268 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00269 //
00270 //    Oct 2005: Snap - Rewrote, made to check data catalogues
00271 //
00272 //**************************************************************************
00273 extern BOOLEAN    FileExistsNoDB( STR strFilename )
00274 {
00275       // First check if it's in the custom Data directory
00276       if ( gCustomDataCat.FindFile(strFilename) ) return TRUE;
00277 
00278       // ... then check if it's in the default Data directory
00279       if ( gDefaultDataCat.FindFile(strFilename) ) return TRUE;
00280 
00281       // ... lastly, try to locate it in the file system
00282       DWORD attribs = GetFileAttributes(strFilename);
00283       if ( attribs != INVALID_FILE_ATTRIBUTES && !(attribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) )
00284             return TRUE;
00285       
00286       return FALSE;
00287 }
00288 
00289 //**************************************************************************
00290 //
00291 // FileDelete
00292 //
00293 //          Deletes a file.
00294 //
00295 // Parameter List :
00296 //
00297 //          STR   -> name of file to delete
00298 //
00299 // Return Value :
00300 //
00301 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00302 //                            -> FALSE if not
00303 //
00304 // Modification history :
00305 //
00306 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00307 //
00308 //**************************************************************************  
00309 BOOLEAN     FileDelete( STR strFilename )
00310 {
00311       // Snap: delete the file from the default Data catalogue (if it is there)
00312       // Since the path can be either relative or absolute, try both methods
00313       gDefaultDataCat.RemoveFile(strFilename, true);
00314       gDefaultDataCat.RemoveFile(strFilename, false);
00315 
00316       return( DeleteFile( (LPCSTR) strFilename ) );
00317 }
00318 
00319 //**************************************************************************
00320 //
00321 // FileOpen
00322 //
00323 //          Opens a file.
00324 //
00325 // Parameter List :
00326 //
00327 //          STR      -> filename
00328 //          UIN32       -> access - read or write, or both
00329 //          BOOLEAN     -> delete on close
00330 //
00331 // Return Value :
00332 //
00333 //          HWFILE      -> handle of opened file
00334 //
00335 // Modification history :
00336 //
00337 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00338 //
00339 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00340 //
00341 //    Oct 2005: Snap - modified to work with the custom Data directory
00342 //
00343 //**************************************************************************
00344 HWFILE FileOpen( STR strFilename, UINT32 uiOptions, BOOLEAN fDeleteOnClose )
00345 {
00346       HWFILE      hFile;
00347       HANDLE      hRealFile;
00348       DWORD       dwAccess;
00349       DWORD       dwFlagsAndAttributes;
00350       BOOLEAN     fExists;
00351       HDBFILE     hDBFile;
00352       DWORD       dwCreationFlags;
00353       HWFILE hLibFile;
00354 
00355       hFile = 0;
00356       hDBFile = 0;
00357       dwCreationFlags = 0;
00358 
00359       dwAccess = 0;
00360       if ( uiOptions & FILE_ACCESS_READ )
00361             dwAccess |= GENERIC_READ;
00362       if ( uiOptions & FILE_ACCESS_WRITE )
00363             dwAccess |= GENERIC_WRITE;
00364 
00365       dwFlagsAndAttributes = FILE_FLAG_RANDOM_ACCESS;
00366       if ( fDeleteOnClose )
00367             dwFlagsAndAttributes |= FILE_FLAG_DELETE_ON_CLOSE;
00368 
00369       // Snap: This seems like an unnecessary check, but I don't feel like
00370       // rewriting the function to eliminate it...
00371 
00372       // check if the file exists - note that we use the function FileExistsNoDB
00373       // because it doesn't check the databases, and we don't want to do that here
00374       fExists = FileExistsNoDB( strFilename );
00375 
00376       // Snap: First see if the file is in the custom Data catalogue:
00377       std::string filePath;
00378       if ( gCustomDataCat.FindFile(strFilename) ) {
00379             filePath = gCustomDataCat.GetRootDir() + '\\';
00380       }
00381       filePath += strFilename;
00382       // Bad cast! strFilename should have been const.  Oh well...
00383       strFilename = const_cast<STR>( filePath.c_str() );
00384       // Now strFilename points either to the original file name,
00385       // or to the full file path in the custom Data directory.
00386       // Except for this substitution, the rest of the function is unchanged.
00387 
00388       //if the file is on the disk
00389       if ( fExists )
00390       {
00391             hRealFile = CreateFile( (LPCSTR) strFilename, dwAccess, 0, NULL, OPEN_ALWAYS,
00392                                                             dwFlagsAndAttributes, NULL );
00393 
00394             if ( hRealFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
00395             {
00396                   return(0);
00397             }
00398 
00399             //create a file handle for the 'real file'
00400             hFile = CreateRealFileHandle( hRealFile );
00401       }
00402 
00403       // if the file did not exist, try to open it from the database
00404       else if ( gFileDataBase.fInitialized ) 
00405       {
00406             //if the file is to be opened for writing, return an error cause you cant write a file that is in the database library
00407             if( fDeleteOnClose )
00408             {
00409                   return( 0 );
00410             }
00411 
00412             //if the file doesnt exist on the harddrive, but it is to be created, dont try to load it from the file database
00413             if( uiOptions & FILE_ACCESS_WRITE )
00414             {
00415                   //if the files is to be written to
00416                   if( ( uiOptions & FILE_CREATE_NEW ) || ( uiOptions & FILE_OPEN_ALWAYS ) || ( uiOptions & FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS ) || ( uiOptions & FILE_TRUNCATE_EXISTING ) )
00417                   {
00418                         hFile = 0;
00419                   }
00420             }
00421             //else if the file is to be opened using FILE_OPEN_EXISTING, and the file doesnt exists, fail out of the function)
00422 //          else if( uiOptions & FILE_OPEN_EXISTING )
00423 //          {
00424                   //fail out of the function
00425 //                return( 0 );
00426 //          }
00427             else
00428             {
00429                   //If the file is in the library, get a handle to it.
00430                   hLibFile = OpenFileFromLibrary( (STR) strFilename );
00431 
00432                   //tried to open a file that wasnt in the database
00433                   if( !hLibFile )
00434                         return( 0 );
00435                   else              
00436                         return( hLibFile );           //return the file handle
00437             }
00438       }
00439 
00440       if ( !hFile )
00441       {
00442             if ( uiOptions & FILE_CREATE_NEW )
00443             {
00444                   dwCreationFlags = CREATE_NEW;
00445             }
00446             else if ( uiOptions & FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS )
00447             {
00448                   dwCreationFlags = CREATE_ALWAYS;
00449             }
00450             else if ( uiOptions & FILE_OPEN_EXISTING || uiOptions & FILE_ACCESS_READ )
00451             {
00452                   dwCreationFlags = OPEN_EXISTING;
00453             }
00454             else if ( uiOptions & FILE_OPEN_ALWAYS )
00455             {
00456                   dwCreationFlags = OPEN_ALWAYS;
00457             }
00458             else if ( uiOptions & FILE_TRUNCATE_EXISTING )
00459             {
00460                   dwCreationFlags = TRUNCATE_EXISTING;
00461             }
00462             else
00463             {
00464                   dwCreationFlags = OPEN_ALWAYS;
00465             }
00466 
00467             
00468             hRealFile = CreateFile( (LPCSTR) strFilename, dwAccess, 0, NULL, dwCreationFlags,
00469                                                             dwFlagsAndAttributes, NULL );
00470             if ( hRealFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
00471             {
00472                         UINT32 uiLastError = GetLastError();
00473                         char zString[1024];
00474                         FormatMessage( FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, 0, uiLastError, 0, zString, 1024, NULL);
00475 
00476                   return(0);
00477             }
00478 
00479             hFile = CreateRealFileHandle( hRealFile );
00480       }
00481 
00482       if ( !hFile )
00483             return(0);
00484 
00485       return(hFile);
00486 }
00487

00490 //**************************************************************************
00491 //
00492 // FileClose
00493 //
00494 //
00495 // Parameter List :
00496 //
00497 //          HWFILE hFile      -> handle to file to close
00498 //
00499 // Return Value :
00500 // Modification history :
00501 //
00502 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00503 //
00504 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00505 //
00506 //**************************************************************************
00507 
00508 void FileClose( HWFILE hFile )
00509 {
00510       INT16 sLibraryID;
00511       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00512 
00513       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00514 
00515       //if its the 'real file' library
00516       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00517       {
00518             //if its not already closed
00519             if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
00520             {
00521                   CloseHandle( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle );
00522                   gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID = 0;
00523                   gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle= 0;
00524                   gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iNumFilesOpen--;
00525                   if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iNumFilesOpen < 0 )
00526                   {
00527                         //if for some reason we are below 0, report an error ( should never be )
00528                         Assert( 0 );
00529                   }
00530             }
00531       }
00532       else
00533       {
00534             //if the database is initialized
00535             if( gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
00536                   CloseLibraryFile( sLibraryID, uiFileNum );
00537       }
00538 }
00539 
00540 //**************************************************************************
00541 //
00542 // FileRead
00543 //
00544 //          To read a file.
00545 //
00546 // Parameter List :
00547 //
00548 //          HWFILE            -> handle to file to read from
00549 //          void  *     -> source buffer
00550 //          UINT32      -> num bytes to read
00551 //          UINT32      -> num bytes read
00552 //
00553 // Return Value :
00554 //
00555 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00556 //                            -> FALSE if not
00557 //
00558 // Modification history :
00559 //
00560 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00561 //          08Dec97:ARM       -> return FALSE if bytes to read != bytes read
00562 //
00563 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00564 //
00565 //**************************************************************************
00566 
00567 #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00568       extern UINT32 uiTotalFileReadTime;
00569       extern UINT32 uiTotalFileReadCalls;
00570       #include "Timer Control.h"
00571 #endif
00572 
00573 
00574 BOOLEAN FileRead( HWFILE hFile, PTR pDest, UINT32 uiBytesToRead, UINT32 *puiBytesRead )
00575 {
00576       HANDLE      hRealFile;
00577       DWORD       dwNumBytesToRead, dwNumBytesRead;
00578       BOOLEAN     fRet = FALSE;
00579       INT16 sLibraryID;
00580       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00581 
00582 #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00583       UINT32 uiStartTime = GetJA2Clock();
00584 #endif
00585 
00586       //init the variables
00587       dwNumBytesToRead = dwNumBytesRead = 0;
00588 
00589       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00590 
00591       dwNumBytesToRead  = (DWORD)uiBytesToRead;
00592 
00593       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00594       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00595       {
00596             //if the file is opened
00597             if( uiFileNum != 0 )
00598             {
00599                   hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
00600 
00601                   fRet = ReadFile( hRealFile, pDest, dwNumBytesToRead, &dwNumBytesRead, NULL );
00602                   if ( dwNumBytesToRead != dwNumBytesRead )
00603                   {
00604                         UINT32 uiLastError = GetLastError();
00605                         char zString[1024];
00606                         FormatMessage( FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, 0, uiLastError, 0, zString, 1024, NULL);
00607 
00608                         fRet = FALSE;
00609                   }
00610 
00611                   if ( puiBytesRead )
00612                         *puiBytesRead = (UINT32)dwNumBytesRead;
00613             }
00614       }
00615       else
00616       {
00617             //if the database is initialized
00618             if( gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
00619             {
00620                   //if the library is open
00621                   if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00622                   {
00623                         //if the file is opened
00624                         if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
00625                         {
00626                               //read the data from the library
00627                               fRet = LoadDataFromLibrary( sLibraryID, uiFileNum, pDest, dwNumBytesToRead, (UINT32 *) &dwNumBytesRead );
00628                               if ( puiBytesRead )
00629                               {
00630                                     *puiBytesRead = (UINT32)dwNumBytesRead;
00631                               }
00632                         }
00633                   }
00634             }
00635       }
00636       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00637             //Add the time that we spent in this function to the total.
00638             uiTotalFileReadTime += GetJA2Clock() - uiStartTime;
00639             uiTotalFileReadCalls++;
00640       #endif
00641 
00642       return(fRet);
00643 }
00644 
00645 //**************************************************************************
00646 //
00647 // FileWrite
00648 //
00649 //          To write a file.
00650 //
00651 // Parameter List :
00652 //
00653 //          HWFILE            -> handle to file to write to
00654 //          void  *     -> destination buffer
00655 //          UINT32      -> num bytes to write
00656 //          UINT32      -> num bytes written
00657 //
00658 // Return Value :
00659 //
00660 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00661 //                            -> FALSE if not
00662 //
00663 // Modification history :
00664 //
00665 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00666 //          08Dec97:ARM       -> return FALSE if dwNumBytesToWrite != dwNumBytesWritten
00667 //
00668 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00669 //
00670 //**************************************************************************
00671 
00672 BOOLEAN FileWrite( HWFILE hFile, PTR pDest, UINT32 uiBytesToWrite, UINT32 *puiBytesWritten )
00673 {
00674       HANDLE      hRealFile;
00675       DWORD       dwNumBytesToWrite, dwNumBytesWritten;
00676       BOOLEAN     fRet;
00677       INT16 sLibraryID;
00678       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00679 
00680 
00681       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00682 
00683       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00684       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00685       {
00686             dwNumBytesToWrite = (DWORD)uiBytesToWrite;
00687 
00688             //get the real file handle to the file
00689             hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
00690 
00691             fRet = WriteFile( hRealFile, pDest, dwNumBytesToWrite, &dwNumBytesWritten, NULL );
00692 
00693             if (dwNumBytesToWrite != dwNumBytesWritten)
00694                   fRet = FALSE;
00695 
00696             if ( puiBytesWritten )
00697                   *puiBytesWritten = (UINT32)dwNumBytesWritten;
00698       }
00699       else
00700       {
00701             //we cannot write to a library file
00702             if ( puiBytesWritten )
00703                   *puiBytesWritten = 0;
00704             return(FALSE);
00705       }
00706 
00707       return(fRet);
00708 }
00709 
00710 //**************************************************************************
00711 //
00712 // FileLoad
00713 //
00714 //          To open, read, and close a file.
00715 //
00716 // Parameter List :
00717 //
00718 //
00719 // Return Value :
00720 //
00721 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00722 //                            -> FALSE if not
00723 //
00724 // Modification history :
00725 //
00726 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00727 //          08Dec97:ARM       -> return FALSE if bytes to read != bytes read (CHECKF is inappropriate?)
00728 //
00729 //**************************************************************************
00730 
00731 BOOLEAN FileLoad( STR strFilename, PTR pDest, UINT32 uiBytesToRead, UINT32 *puiBytesRead )
00732 {
00733       HWFILE      hFile;
00734       UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
00735       BOOLEAN     fRet;
00736 
00737       hFile = FileOpen( strFilename, FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE );
00738       if ( hFile )
00739       {
00740             fRet = FileRead( hFile, pDest, uiBytesToRead, &uiNumBytesRead );
00741             FileClose( hFile );
00742 
00743             if (uiBytesToRead != uiNumBytesRead)
00744                   fRet = FALSE;
00745 
00746             if ( puiBytesRead )
00747                   *puiBytesRead = uiNumBytesRead;
00748 
00749             CHECKF( uiNumBytesRead == uiBytesToRead );
00750       }
00751       else
00752             fRet = FALSE;
00753 
00754       return(fRet);
00755 }
00756 
00757 //**************************************************************************
00758 //
00759 // FilePrintf
00760 //
00761 //          To printf to a file.
00762 //
00763 // Parameter List :
00764 //
00765 //          HWFILE      -> handle to file to seek in
00766 //          ...         -> arguments, 1st of which should be a string
00767 //
00768 // Return Value :
00769 //
00770 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00771 //                            -> FALSE if not
00772 //
00773 // Modification history :
00774 //
00775 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00776 //
00777 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00778 //
00779 //**************************************************************************
00780 BOOLEAN _cdecl FilePrintf( HWFILE hFile, char * strFormatted, ... )
00781 {
00782       UINT8       strToSend[80];
00783       va_list     argptr;
00784       BOOLEAN fRetVal = FALSE;
00785 
00786       INT16 sLibraryID;
00787       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00788 
00789       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00790 
00791       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00792       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00793       {
00794             va_start(argptr, strFormatted);
00795             vsprintf( (char *)strToSend, (char *)strFormatted, argptr );
00796             va_end(argptr);
00797             
00798             fRetVal = FileWrite( hFile, strToSend, strlen(strToSend), NULL );
00799       }
00800       else
00801       {
00802             //its a library file, cant write to it so return an error
00803             fRetVal = FALSE;
00804       }
00805 
00806       return( fRetVal );
00807 }
00808 
00809 //**************************************************************************
00810 //
00811 // FileSeek
00812 //
00813 //          To seek to a position in a file.
00814 //
00815 // Parameter List :
00816 //
00817 //          HWFILE      -> handle to file to seek in
00818 //          UINT32      -> distance to seek
00819 //          UINT8       -> how to seek
00820 //
00821 // Return Value :
00822 //
00823 //          BOOLEAN     -> TRUE if successful
00824 //                            -> FALSE if not
00825 //
00826 // Modification history :
00827 //
00828 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00829 //
00830 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00831 //
00832 //**************************************************************************
00833 
00834 BOOLEAN FileSeek( HWFILE hFile, UINT32 uiDistance, UINT8 uiHow )
00835 {
00836       HANDLE      hRealFile;
00837       LONG        lDistanceToMove;
00838       DWORD       dwMoveMethod;
00839       INT32       iDistance=0;
00840 
00841       INT16 sLibraryID;
00842       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00843 
00844       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00845 
00846       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00847       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00848       {
00849             //Get the handle to the real file
00850             hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
00851 
00852             iDistance = (INT32) uiDistance;
00853 
00854             if ( uiHow == FILE_SEEK_FROM_START )
00855                   dwMoveMethod = FILE_BEGIN;
00856             else if ( uiHow == FILE_SEEK_FROM_END )
00857             {
00858                   dwMoveMethod = FILE_END;
00859                   if( iDistance > 0 )
00860                         iDistance = -(iDistance);
00861             }
00862             else
00863                   dwMoveMethod = FILE_CURRENT;
00864 
00865             lDistanceToMove = (LONG)uiDistance;
00866 
00867             if ( SetFilePointer( hRealFile, iDistance, NULL, dwMoveMethod ) == 0xFFFFFFFF )
00868                   return(FALSE);
00869       }
00870       else
00871       {
00872             //if the database is initialized
00873             if( gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
00874                   LibraryFileSeek( sLibraryID, uiFileNum, uiDistance, uiHow );
00875       }
00876 
00877       return(TRUE);
00878 }
00879 
00880 //**************************************************************************
00881 //
00882 // FileGetPos
00883 //
00884 //          To get the current position in a file.
00885 //
00886 // Parameter List :
00887 //
00888 //          HWFILE      -> handle to file
00889 //
00890 // Return Value :
00891 //
00892 //          INT32       -> current offset in file if successful
00893 //                            -> -1 if not
00894 //
00895 // Modification history :
00896 //
00897 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00898 //
00899 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00900 //
00901 //**************************************************************************
00902 
00903 INT32 FileGetPos( HWFILE hFile )
00904 {
00905       HANDLE      hRealFile;
00906       UINT32      uiPositionInFile=0;
00907 
00908       INT16 sLibraryID;
00909       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00910 
00911       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00912 
00913       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00914       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00915       {
00916             //Get the handle to the real file
00917             hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
00918 
00919             uiPositionInFile = SetFilePointer( hRealFile, 0, NULL, FILE_CURRENT);
00920             if( uiPositionInFile == 0xFFFFFFFF )
00921             {
00922                   uiPositionInFile = 0;
00923             }
00924             return( uiPositionInFile );
00925       }
00926       else
00927       {
00928             //if the library is open
00929             if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00930             {
00931                   //check if the file is open
00932                   if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
00933                   {
00934                         uiPositionInFile = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile;
00935                         return( uiPositionInFile );
00936                   }
00937             }
00938       }
00939 
00940       return(BAD_INDEX);
00941 }
00942 
00943 //**************************************************************************
00944 //
00945 // FileGetSize
00946 //
00947 //          To get the current file size.
00948 //
00949 // Parameter List :
00950 //
00951 //          HWFILE      -> handle to file
00952 //
00953 // Return Value :
00954 //
00955 //          INT32       -> file size in file if successful
00956 //                            -> 0 if not
00957 //
00958 // Modification history :
00959 //
00960 //          24sep96:HJH       -> creation
00961 //
00962 //          9 Feb 98    DEF - modified to work with the library system
00963 //
00964 //**************************************************************************
00965 
00966 UINT32 FileGetSize( HWFILE hFile )
00967 {
00968       HANDLE  hRealHandle;
00969       UINT32      uiFileSize = 0xFFFFFFFF;
00970 
00971       INT16 sLibraryID;
00972       UINT32 uiFileNum;
00973 
00974       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
00975 
00976       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
00977       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
00978       {
00979             //Get the handle to a real file
00980             hRealHandle = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
00981 
00982             uiFileSize = GetFileSize( hRealHandle, NULL );
00983       }
00984       else
00985       {
00986             //if the library is open
00987             if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00988                   uiFileSize = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileLength;
00989       }
00990 
00991 
00992       if ( uiFileSize == 0xFFFFFFFF )
00993             return(0);
00994       else
00995             return( uiFileSize );
00996 }

01032 HANDLE GetHandleToRealFile( HWFILE hFile, BOOLEAN *pfDatabaseFile )

01035

01048       else

01050             *pfDatabaseFile = TRUE;

01246 
01247 //**************************************************************************
01248 //
01249 // GetFilesInDirectory
01250 //
01251 //          Gets the files in a directory and the subdirectories.
01252 //
01253 // Parameter List :
01254 // Return Value :
01255 // Modification history :
01256 //
01257 //          ??nov96:HJH       -> creation
01258 //
01259 //**************************************************************************
01260 
01261 INT32 GetFilesInDirectory( HCONTAINER hStack, CHAR *pcDir, HANDLE hFile, WIN32_FIND_DATA *pFind )
01262 {
01263       INT32                         iNumFiles;
01264       WIN32_FIND_DATA   inFind;
01265       BOOLEAN                       fMore;
01266       CHAR                          cName[FILENAME_LENGTH], cDir[FILENAME_LENGTH];
01267       HANDLE                        hFileIn;
01268 
01269       fMore = TRUE;
01270       iNumFiles = 0;
01271 
01272       while ( fMore )
01273       {
01274             if ( pFind->dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY )
01275             {
01276                   if ( strcmp( pFind->cFileName, "." ) != 0 && strcmp( pFind->cFileName, ".." ) != 0 )
01277                   {
01278                         // a valid directory - recurse and find the files in that directory
01279 
01280                         inFind.dwFileAttributes = FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL | FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY;
01281                         strcpy( cDir, pcDir );
01282                         strcpy( &(cDir[strlen(cDir)-3]), pFind->cFileName );
01283                         strcpy( &(cDir[strlen(cDir)]), "\\*.*\0" );
01284                         hFileIn = FindFirstFile( cDir, &inFind );
01285                         iNumFiles += GetFilesInDirectory( hStack, cDir, hFileIn, &inFind );
01286                         FindClose( hFileIn );
01287                   }
01288             }
01289             else
01290             {
01291                   iNumFiles++;
01292                   strcpy( cName, pcDir );
01293                   strcpy( &(cName[strlen(cName)-3]), pFind->cFileName );
01294                   CharLower( cName );
01295                   hStack = Push( hStack, cName );
01296             }
01297             pFind->dwFileAttributes = FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL | FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY;
01298             fMore = FindNextFile( hFile, pFind );
01299       }
01300 
01301       return(iNumFiles);
01302 }
01303 
01304 BOOLEAN SetFileManCurrentDirectory( STR pcDirectory )
01305 {
01306        return( SetCurrentDirectory( pcDirectory ) );
01307 }
01308 
01309 
01310 BOOLEAN GetFileManCurrentDirectory( STRING512 pcDirectory )
01311 {
01312       if (GetCurrentDirectory( 512, pcDirectory ) == 0)
01313       {
01314             return( FALSE );
01315       }
01316       return( TRUE );
01317 }
01318 
01319 
01320 BOOLEAN DirectoryExists( STRING512 pcDirectory )
01321 {
01322       UINT32      uiAttribs;
01323       DWORD       uiLastError;
01324 
01325       uiAttribs = GetFileAttributes( pcDirectory );
01326 
01327       if ( uiAttribs == 0xFFFFFFFF )
01328       {
01329             // an error, make sure it's the right error
01330             uiLastError =     GetLastError();
01331 
01332             if (uiLastError != ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND)
01333             {
01334             FastDebugMsg(String("DirectoryExists: ERROR - GetFileAttributes failed, error #%d on file %s", uiLastError, pcDirectory));
01335             }
01336       }
01337       else
01338       {
01339             // something's there, make sure it's a directory
01340             if ( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY )
01341             {
01342                   return TRUE;
01343             }
01344       }
01345 
01346       // this could also mean that the name given is that of a file, or that an error occurred
01347       return FALSE;
01348 }
01349 
01350 
01351 BOOLEAN MakeFileManDirectory( STRING512 pcDirectory )
01352 {
01353       return CreateDirectory( pcDirectory, NULL );
01354 }
01355 
01356 
01357 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01358 // Removes ALL FILES in the specified directory (and all subdirectories with their files if fRecursive is TRUE)
01359 // Use EraseDirectory() to simply delete directory contents without deleting the directory itself
01360 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01361 BOOLEAN RemoveFileManDirectory( STRING512 pcDirectory, BOOLEAN fRecursive )
01362 {
01363       WIN32_FIND_DATA sFindData;
01364       HANDLE            SearchHandle;
01365       const CHAR8 *pFileSpec = "*.*";
01366       BOOLEAN     fDone = FALSE;
01367       BOOLEAN fRetval=FALSE;
01368       CHAR8       zOldDir[512];
01369       CHAR8       zSubdirectory[512];
01370 
01371       GetFileManCurrentDirectory( zOldDir );
01372 
01373       if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( pcDirectory ) )
01374       {
01375             FastDebugMsg(String("RemoveFileManDirectory: ERROR - SetFileManCurrentDirectory on %s failed, error %d", pcDirectory, GetLastError()));
01376             return( FALSE );        //Error going into directory
01377       }
01378 
01379       //If there are files in the directory, DELETE THEM
01380       SearchHandle = FindFirstFile( pFileSpec, &sFindData);
01381       if( SearchHandle !=  INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
01382       {
01383 
01384             fDone = FALSE;
01385             do
01386             {
01387                   // if the object is a directory
01388                   if( GetFileAttributes( sFindData.cFileName ) == FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY )
01389                   {
01390                         // only go in if the fRecursive flag is TRUE (like Deltree)
01391                         if (fRecursive)
01392                         {
01393                               sprintf(zSubdirectory, "%s\\%s", pcDirectory, sFindData.cFileName);
01394 
01395                               if ((strcmp(sFindData.cFileName, ".") != 0) && (strcmp(sFindData.cFileName, "..") != 0))
01396                               {
01397                                     if (!RemoveFileManDirectory(zSubdirectory, TRUE))
01398                                     {
01399                                     FastDebugMsg(String("RemoveFileManDirectory: ERROR - Recursive call on %s failed", zSubdirectory));
01400                                           break;
01401                                     }
01402                               }
01403                         }
01404                         // otherwise, all the individual files will be deleted, but the subdirectories remain, causing
01405                         // RemoveDirectory() at the end to fail, thus this function will return FALSE in that event (failure)
01406                   }
01407                   else
01408                   {
01409                         FileDelete( sFindData.cFileName );
01410                   }
01411 
01412                   //find the next file in the directory
01413                   fRetval = FindNextFile( SearchHandle, &sFindData );
01414                   if( fRetval == 0 )
01415                   {
01416                         fDone = TRUE;
01417                   }
01418             }     while(!fDone);
01419 
01420             // very important: close the find handle, or subsequent RemoveDirectory() calls will fail
01421             FindClose( SearchHandle );
01422       }
01423 
01424       if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( zOldDir ) )
01425       {
01426             FastDebugMsg(String("RemoveFileManDirectory: ERROR - SetFileManCurrentDirectory on %s failed, error %d", zOldDir, GetLastError()));
01427             return( FALSE );        //Error returning from subdirectory
01428       }
01429 
01430       
01431       // The directory MUST be empty
01432       fRetval = RemoveDirectory( pcDirectory );
01433       if (!fRetval)
01434       {
01435             FastDebugMsg(String("RemoveFileManDirectory: ERROR - RemoveDirectory on %s failed, error %d", pcDirectory, GetLastError()));
01436       }
01437 
01438       return fRetval;
01439 }
01440 
01441 
01442 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01443 // Removes ALL FILES in the specified directory but leaves the directory alone.  Does not affect any subdirectories!
01444 // Use RemoveFilemanDirectory() to also delete the directory itself, or to recursively delete subdirectories.
01445 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01446 BOOLEAN EraseDirectory( STRING512 pcDirectory)
01447 {
01448       WIN32_FIND_DATA sFindData;
01449       HANDLE            SearchHandle;
01450       const CHAR8 *pFileSpec = "*.*";
01451       BOOLEAN     fDone = FALSE;
01452       CHAR8       zOldDir[512];
01453 
01454       GetFileManCurrentDirectory( zOldDir );
01455 
01456       if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( pcDirectory ) )
01457       {
01458             FastDebugMsg(String("EraseDirectory: ERROR - SetFileManCurrentDirectory on %s failed, error %d", pcDirectory, GetLastError()));
01459             return( FALSE );        //Error going into directory
01460       }
01461 
01462       //If there are files in the directory, DELETE THEM
01463       SearchHandle = FindFirstFile( pFileSpec, &sFindData);
01464       if( SearchHandle !=  INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
01465       {
01466 
01467             fDone = FALSE;
01468             do
01469             {
01470                   // if it's a file, not a directory
01471                   if( GetFileAttributes( sFindData.cFileName ) != FILE_ATTRIBUTES_DIRECTORY )
01472                   {
01473                         FileDelete( sFindData.cFileName );
01474                   }
01475 
01476                   //find the next file in the directory
01477                   if ( !FindNextFile( SearchHandle, &sFindData ))
01478                   {
01479                         fDone = TRUE;
01480                   }
01481             } while(!fDone);
01482 
01483             // very important: close the find handle, or subsequent RemoveDirectory() calls will fail
01484             FindClose( SearchHandle );
01485       }
01486 
01487       // Snap: Delete the directory from the default Data catalogue (if it is there)
01488       // Since the path can be either relative or absolute, try both methods
01489       gDefaultDataCat.RemoveDir(pcDirectory, true);
01490       gDefaultDataCat.RemoveDir(pcDirectory, false);
01491 
01492       if( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( zOldDir ) )
01493       {
01494             FastDebugMsg(String("EraseDirectory: ERROR - SetFileManCurrentDirectory on %s failed, error %d", zOldDir, GetLastError()));
01495             return( FALSE );        //Error returning from directory
01496       }
01497 
01498       return( TRUE );
01499 }
01500 
01501 
01502 BOOLEAN GetExecutableDirectory( STRING512 pcDirectory )
01503 {
01504       SGPFILENAME ModuleFilename;
01505       UINT32 cnt;
01506 
01507       if ( GetModuleFileName( NULL, ModuleFilename, sizeof( ModuleFilename ) ) == 0 )
01508       {
01509             return( FALSE );
01510       }
01511 
01512       // Now get directory
01513       strcpy( pcDirectory, ModuleFilename );
01514 
01515       for ( cnt = strlen( pcDirectory ) - 1; cnt >= 0; cnt -- )
01516       {
01517             if ( pcDirectory[ cnt ] == '\\' )
01518             {
01519                    pcDirectory[ cnt ] = '\0';
01520                    break;
01521             }
01522       }
01523 
01524       return( TRUE );
01525 }
01526 
01527 BOOLEAN GetFileFirst( CHAR8 * pSpec, GETFILESTRUCT *pGFStruct )
01528 {
01529       INT32 x,iWhich=0;
01530       BOOLEAN fFound;
01531 
01532       CHECKF( pSpec != NULL );
01533       CHECKF( pGFStruct != NULL );
01534 
01535       fFound = FALSE;
01536       for( x = 0; x < 20 && !fFound; x++)
01537       {
01538             if( !fFindInfoInUse[x] )
01539             {
01540                   iWhich = x;
01541                   fFound = TRUE;
01542             }
01543       }
01544 
01545       if ( !fFound )
01546             return(FALSE);
01547 
01548       pGFStruct->iFindHandle = iWhich;
01549 
01550       hFindInfoHandle[iWhich] = FindFirstFile( pSpec, &Win32FindInfo[iWhich] );
01551       
01552       if ( hFindInfoHandle[iWhich] == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
01553             return(FALSE);
01554       fFindInfoInUse[iWhich] = TRUE;
01555 
01556       W32toSGPFileFind( pGFStruct, &Win32FindInfo[iWhich] );
01557 
01558       return(TRUE);
01559 }
01560 
01561 BOOLEAN GetFileNext( GETFILESTRUCT *pGFStruct )
01562 {
01563       CHECKF( pGFStruct != NULL );
01564       
01565       if ( FindNextFile(hFindInfoHandle[pGFStruct->iFindHandle], &Win32FindInfo[pGFStruct->iFindHandle]) )
01566       {
01567             W32toSGPFileFind( pGFStruct, &Win32FindInfo[pGFStruct->iFindHandle] );
01568             return(TRUE);
01569       }
01570       return(FALSE);
01571 }
01572 
01573 void GetFileClose( GETFILESTRUCT *pGFStruct )
01574 {
01575       if ( pGFStruct == NULL )
01576             return;
01577 
01578       FindClose( hFindInfoHandle[pGFStruct->iFindHandle] );
01579       hFindInfoHandle[pGFStruct->iFindHandle] = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
01580       fFindInfoInUse[pGFStruct->iFindHandle] = FALSE;
01581 
01582       return;
01583 }
01584 
01585 void W32toSGPFileFind( GETFILESTRUCT *pGFStruct, WIN32_FIND_DATA *pW32Struct )
01586 {
01587       UINT32 uiAttribMask;
01588 
01589       // Copy the filename
01590       strcpy(pGFStruct->zFileName, pW32Struct->cFileName);
01591 
01592       // Get file size
01593       if ( pW32Struct->nFileSizeHigh != 0 )
01594             pGFStruct->uiFileSize = 0xffffffff;
01595       else
01596             pGFStruct->uiFileSize = pW32Struct->nFileSizeLow;
01597 
01598       // Copy the file attributes
01599       pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs = 0;
01600 
01601       for( uiAttribMask = 0x80000000; uiAttribMask > 0; uiAttribMask >>= 1)
01602       {
01603             switch( pW32Struct->dwFileAttributes & uiAttribMask )
01604             {
01605                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE:
01606                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_ARCHIVE;
01607                         break;
01608 
01609                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY:
01610                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_DIRECTORY;
01611                         break;
01612                   
01613                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN:
01614                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_HIDDEN;
01615                         break;
01616                   
01617                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL:   
01618                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_NORMAL;
01619                         break;
01620                   
01621                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY:
01622                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_READONLY;
01623                         break;
01624                   
01625                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM:
01626                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_SYSTEM;
01627                         break;
01628                   
01629                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY:
01630                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_TEMPORARY;
01631                         break;
01632 
01633                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_COMPRESSED:
01634                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_COMPRESSED;
01635                         break;
01636 
01637                   case FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE:
01638                         pGFStruct->uiFileAttribs |= FILE_IS_OFFLINE;
01639                         break;
01640             }
01641       }
01642 }

01729 BOOLEAN FileSetAttributes( STR strFilename, UINT32 uiNewAttribs )
01730 {
01731       UINT32      uiFileAttrib = 0;
01732 
01733       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_ARCHIVE )
01734             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE;
01735 
01736       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_HIDDEN )
01737             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN;
01738 
01739       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_NORMAL )
01740             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL;
01741 
01742       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_OFFLINE )
01743             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE;
01744 
01745       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_READONLY )
01746             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY;
01747 
01748       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_SYSTEM )
01749             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM;
01750 
01751       if( uiNewAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTES_TEMPORARY )
01752             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY;
01753 
01754       return SetFileAttributes( strFilename, uiFileAttrib );
01755 }

01757 
01758 UINT32 FileGetAttributes( STR strFilename )
01759 {
01760       UINT32      uiAttribs = 0;
01761       UINT32      uiFileAttrib = 0;
01762 
01763       uiAttribs = GetFileAttributes( strFilename );
01764 
01765       if( uiAttribs == 0xFFFFFFFF )
01766             return( uiAttribs );
01767 
01768       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE )
01769             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_ARCHIVE;
01770 
01771       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN )
01772             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_HIDDEN;
01773 
01774       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL )
01775             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_NORMAL;
01776 
01777       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE )
01778             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_OFFLINE;
01779 
01780       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY )
01781             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_READONLY;
01782 
01783       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM     )
01784             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_SYSTEM;
01785 
01786       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY )
01787             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_TEMPORARY;
01788 
01789       if( uiAttribs & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY )
01790             uiFileAttrib |= FILE_ATTRIBUTES_DIRECTORY;
01791 
01792       
01793 
01794       return( uiFileAttrib );
01795 }

01803 //returns true if at end of file, else false
01804 BOOLEAN     FileCheckEndOfFile( HWFILE hFile )
01805 {
01806       INT16 sLibraryID;
01807       UINT32 uiFileNum;
01808       HANDLE      hRealFile;
01809 //    UINT8       Data;
01810       UINT32      uiNumberOfBytesRead=0;
01811       UINT32      uiOldFilePtrLoc=0;
01812       UINT32      uiEndOfFilePtrLoc=0;
01813       UINT32      temp=0;
01814 
01815       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
01816 
01817       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
01818       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
01819       {
01820             //Get the handle to the real file
01821             hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
01822 
01823             //Get the current position of the file pointer
01824             uiOldFilePtrLoc = SetFilePointer( hRealFile, 0, NULL, FILE_CURRENT );
01825 
01826             //Get the end of file ptr location
01827             uiEndOfFilePtrLoc = SetFilePointer( hRealFile, 0, NULL, FILE_END );
01828 
01829             //reset back to the original location
01830             temp = SetFilePointer( hRealFile, -( (INT32)( uiEndOfFilePtrLoc - uiOldFilePtrLoc ) ), NULL, FILE_END );
01831 
01832             //if the 2 pointers are the same, we are at the end of a file
01833             if( uiEndOfFilePtrLoc <= uiOldFilePtrLoc )
01834             {
01835                   return( 1 );
01836             }
01837       }
01838 
01839       //else it is a library file
01840       else
01841       {
01842             //if the database is initialized
01843             if( gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
01844             {
01845                   //if the library is open
01846                   if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
01847                   {
01848                         //if the file is opened
01849                         if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
01850                         {
01851                               UINT32      uiLength;                           //uiOffsetInLibrary
01852 //                            HANDLE      hLibraryFile;
01853 //                            UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
01854                               UINT32      uiCurPos;
01855 
01856                               uiLength = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileLength;
01857                               uiCurPos = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile;
01858 
01859                               //if we are trying to read more data then the size of the file, return an error
01860                               if( uiCurPos >= uiLength )
01861                               {
01862                                     return( TRUE );
01863                               }
01864                         }
01865                   }
01866             }
01867       }
01868 
01869       //we are not and the end of a file
01870       return( 0 );
01871 }

01875 BOOLEAN GetFileManFileTime( HWFILE hFile, SGP_FILETIME      *pCreationTime, SGP_FILETIME *pLastAccessedTime, SGP_FILETIME *pLastWriteTime )
01876 {
01877       HANDLE      hRealFile;
01878       INT16 sLibraryID;
01879       UINT32 uiFileNum;
01880 
01881       FILETIME    sCreationUtcFileTime;
01882       FILETIME    sLastAccessedUtcFileTime;
01883       FILETIME    sLastWriteUtcFileTime;
01884 
01885       //Initialize the passed in variables
01886       memset( pCreationTime, 0, sizeof( SGP_FILETIME ) );
01887       memset( pLastAccessedTime, 0, sizeof( SGP_FILETIME ) );
01888       memset( pLastWriteTime, 0, sizeof( SGP_FILETIME ) );
01889 
01890 
01891       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
01892 
01893       //if its a real file, read the data from the file
01894       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
01895       {
01896             //get the real file handle to the file
01897             hRealFile = gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle;
01898 
01899             //Gets the UTC file time for the 'real' file                      
01900             GetFileTime( hRealFile, &sCreationUtcFileTime, &sLastAccessedUtcFileTime, &sLastWriteUtcFileTime );
01901 
01902             //converts the creation UTC file time to the current time used for the file
01903             FileTimeToLocalFileTime( &sCreationUtcFileTime, pCreationTime );
01904             
01905             //converts the accessed UTC file time to the current time used for the file
01906             FileTimeToLocalFileTime( &sLastAccessedUtcFileTime, pLastAccessedTime );
01907 
01908             //converts the write UTC file time to the current time used for the file
01909             FileTimeToLocalFileTime( &sLastWriteUtcFileTime, pLastWriteTime );
01910       }
01911       else
01912       {
01913             //if the database is initialized
01914             if( gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
01915             {
01916                   //if the library is open
01917                   if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
01918                   {
01919                         //if the file is opened
01920                         if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
01921                         {
01922                               if( !GetLibraryFileTime( sLibraryID, uiFileNum, pLastWriteTime ) )
01923                               {
01924                                     return( FALSE );
01925                               }
01926                         }
01927                   }
01928             }
01929       }
01930 
01931       return( TRUE );
01932 }

01943 UINT32 uiSize;

01945       if((hFile=FileOpen(strFilename, FILE_OPEN_EXISTING | FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE))==0)

01955 
01956 HANDLE      GetRealFileHandleFromFileManFileHandle( HWFILE hFile )
01957 {
01958       INT16 sLibraryID;
01959       UINT32 uiFileNum;
01960 
01961       GetLibraryAndFileIDFromLibraryFileHandle( hFile, &sLibraryID, &uiFileNum );
01962 
01963       //if its the 'real file' library
01964       if( sLibraryID == REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID )
01965       {
01966             //if its not already closed
01967             if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
01968             {
01969                   return( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ uiFileNum ].hRealFileHandle );
01970             }
01971       }
01972       else
01973       {
01974             //if the file is not opened, dont close it
01975             if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID != 0 )
01976             {
01977                   return( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle );
01978             }
01979       }
01980       return( 0 );
01981 }

01983 //**************************************************************************
01984 //
01985 // AddSubdirectoryToPath
01986 //
01987 //          Puts a subdirectory of the current working directory into the current 
01988 // task's system path. 
01989 //
01990 // Parameter List :
01991 // Return Value :
01992 // Modification history :
01993 //
01994 //          10June98:DB       -> creation
01995 //
01996 //**************************************************************************
01997 BOOLEAN AddSubdirectoryToPath(CHAR8 *pDirectory)
01998 {
01999 CHAR8 *pSystemPath;
02000 CHAR8 *pPath;
02001 UINT32 uiPathLen;
02002 
02003       // Check for NULL
02004       if(!pDirectory)
02005             return(FALSE);
02006 
02007       // Check for zero length string
02008       if(!strlen(pDirectory))
02009             return(FALSE);
02010 
02011       if((pSystemPath=(CHAR8 *)MemAlloc(_MAX_PATH))==NULL)
02012             return(FALSE);
02013 
02014       memset(pSystemPath, 0, _MAX_PATH);
02015 
02016       if((pPath=(CHAR8 *)MemAlloc(_MAX_PATH))==NULL)
02017       {
02018             MemFree(pSystemPath);
02019             return(FALSE);
02020       }
02021 
02022       memset(pPath, 0, _MAX_PATH);
02023 
02024       // Builds a path to the directory with the SR DLL files.
02025       _getcwd(pPath, _MAX_PATH);
02026       uiPathLen=strlen(pPath);
02027       if(uiPathLen)
02028             uiPathLen--;
02029       if(pPath[uiPathLen]!='\\')
02030             strcat(pPath, "\\");
02031       
02032       strcat(pPath, pDirectory);
02033 
02034       // Appends it to the path for the current task
02035       if(GetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", pSystemPath, _MAX_PATH))
02036       {
02037             strcat(pSystemPath, ";");
02038             strcat(pSystemPath, pPath);
02039             SetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", pSystemPath);
02040             MemFree(pSystemPath);
02041             MemFree(pPath);
02042             return(TRUE);
02043       }
02044       else
02045       {
02046             MemFree(pSystemPath);
02047             MemFree(pPath);
02048             return(FALSE);
02049       }
02050       
02051 }

02054 UINT32 GetFreeSpaceOnHardDriveWhereGameIsRunningFrom( )
02055 {
02056   STRING512       zExecDir;
02057   STRING512       zDrive;
02058       STRING512         zDir;
02059       STRING512         zFileName;
02060       STRING512         zExt;
02061 
02062       UINT32 uiFreeSpace = 0;
02063 
02064       GetExecutableDirectory( zExecDir );
02065 
02066       //get the drive letter from the exec dir
02067       _splitpath( zExecDir, zDrive, zDir, zFileName, zExt);
02068 
02069       sprintf( zDrive, "%s\\", zDrive );
02070       
02071       uiFreeSpace = GetFreeSpaceOnHardDrive( zDrive );
02072 
02073       return( uiFreeSpace );
02074 }

02078 
02079 UINT32 GetFreeSpaceOnHardDrive( STR pzDriveLetter )
02080 {
02081       UINT32                  uiBytesFree=0;
02082 
02083       UINT32                  uiSectorsPerCluster=0;
02084       UINT32                  uiBytesPerSector=0;
02085       UINT32                  uiNumberOfFreeClusters=0;
02086       UINT32                  uiTotalNumberOfClusters=0;
02087 
02088       if( !GetDiskFreeSpace( pzDriveLetter, (LPDWORD) &uiSectorsPerCluster, (LPDWORD) &uiBytesPerSector, 
02089                   (LPDWORD) &uiNumberOfFreeClusters, (LPDWORD) &uiTotalNumberOfClusters ) )
02090       {
02091             UINT32 uiLastError = GetLastError();
02092             char zString[1024];
02093             FormatMessage( FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, 0, uiLastError, 0, zString, 1024, NULL);
02094 
02095             return( TRUE );
02096       }
02097 
02098       uiBytesFree = uiBytesPerSector * uiNumberOfFreeClusters * uiSectorsPerCluster;
02099 
02100       return( uiBytesFree );
02101 }
